extra_headers.description: Additional HTTP headers to set on each API call.

mock.description: When set to true, the Terraform provider runs against an internal simulation. This should only be used for testing when an oVirt engine is not available as the mock backend does not persist state across runs. When set to false, one of the tls_ options is required.

password.description: Password for oVirt authentication. Required when mock = false.

tls_ca_bundle.description: Validate the Engine certificate against the provided CA certificates. The certificate chain passed should be in PEM format. Can be used in parallel with other tls_ options, one tls_ option is required when mock = false.

tls_ca_dirs.description: Validate the engine certificate against the CA certificates provided in the specified directories. The directory should contain only files with certificates in PEM format. Can be used in parallel with other tls_ options, one tls_ option is required when mock = false.

tls_ca_files.description: Validate the Engine certificate against the CA certificates provided in the files in this parameter. The files should contain certificates in PEM format. Can be used in parallel with other tls_ options, one tls_ option is required when mock = false.

tls_insecure.description: Disable certificate verification when connecting the Engine. This is not recommended. Setting this option is incompatible with other tls_ options.

tls_system.description: Use the system certificate pool to verify the Engine certificate. This does not work on Windows. Can be used in parallel with other tls_ options, one tls_ option is required when mock = false.

url.description: URL for the oVirt engine. Required when mock = false.

username.description: Username and realm for oVirt authentication. Required when mock = false.

format.description: Format for the disk. One of: `cow`, `raw`

status.description: Status of the disk. One of: `down`, `image_locked`, `migrating`, `not_responding`, `paused`, `powering_down`, `powering_up`, `reboot_in_progress`, `restoring_state`, `saving_state`, `suspended`, `unassigned`, `unknown`, `up`, `wait_for_launch`.

storagedomain_id.description: ID of the storage domain to use for disk creation.

total_size.description: Size of the actual image size on the disk in bytes.

block.description: The ovirt_disk resource creates disks in oVirt.

disk_id.description: ID of the disk to attach. This disk must either be shared or not yet attached to a different VM.

disk_interface.description: Type of interface to use for attaching disk. One of: `ide`, `sata`, `spapr_vscsi`, `virtio`, `virtio_scsi`.

vm_id.description: ID of the VM the disk should be attached to.

block.description:
The ovirt_disk_attachment resource attaches a single disk to a single VM. For controlling multiple attachments use ovirt_disk_attachments.

~> Do not use this resource when using ovirt_disk_attachments (plural) on the same VM as it will cause a ping-pong effect of resources being created and removed on each run.

detach_unmanaged.description: Detach unmanaged disks from the VM. This is useful for detaching disks that have been inherited from the template or added manually. The detached disks will not be removed and can be used. To remove the disks instead, use `remove_unmanaged`.

id.description: Meta-identifier for the disk attachments. Will always be the same as the VM ID after apply.

remove_unmanaged.description:
Completely remove attached disks that are not listed in this resources. This is useful for removing disks that have been inherited from the template or added manually.

~> Use with care! This option will delete all disks attached to the current VM that are not managed, not just detach them!

vm_id.description: ID of the VM the disks should be attached to.

disk_id.description: ID of the disk to attach. This disk must either be shared or not yet attached to a different VM.

disk_interface.description: Type of interface to use for attaching disk. One of: `ide`, `sata`, `spapr_vscsi`, `virtio`, `virtio_scsi`.

block.description:
The ovirt_disk_attachments resource attaches multiple disks to a single VM in one operation. It also allows for removing all attachments that are not declared in an attachment block. This is useful for removing attachments that have been added from the template.

~> Do not use this resource on the same VM as ovirt_disk_attachment (singular). It will cause a ping-pong effect of resources being created and removed on each Terraform run.

vm_id.description: ID of the VM to attach this NIC to.

vnic_profile_id.description: ID of the VNIC profile to associate with this NIC.

block.description: The ovirt_nic resource creates network interfaces in oVirt.

cluster_id.description: Cluster to create this VM on.

name.description: User-provided name for the VM. Must only consist of lower- and uppercase letters, numbers, dash, underscore and dot.

status.description: Status of the virtual machine. One of: `down`, `image_locked`, `migrating`, `not_responding`, `paused`, `powering_down`, `powering_up`, `reboot_in_progress`, `restoring_state`, `saving_state`, `suspended`, `unassigned`, `unknown`, `up`, `wait_for_launch`.

block.description: The ovirt_vm resource creates a virtual machine in oVirt.
